speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I heard the most extraordinary thing on the radio today.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.  Rubenstein's torrid survey of the Copin mazurkas. It took all my strength not to turn the car around, drive home and ravish my wife.

speaker: Roz
text: That Daphne is one lucky lady.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I was referring to the fact that Maris has been released on bail.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes.  Of course she's still under house arrest until her murder trial.  Poor thing, has to wear an electronic tracking device on her ankle.  She can't keep the press off her back, they're printing the most vicious stories about her.

speaker: Roz
text: I saw one of those.  Is it true that she fired one of the gardeners because she found a worm on the front walk?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, to be fair, Maris has always been frightened and disgusted by them.

speaker: Roz
text: It's just a stupid worm.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'm talking about gardeners.  [_Martin walks into the coffee shop._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hey, Dad.  Why don't you pull up a chair?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.  [_Niles moves over so Martin can sit down._]

speaker: Roz
text: You're looking sharp.  I don't think I've ever seen this jacket.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's because I don't wear it too often.  But you know, when I do, sometimes I find all kinds of junk in the pockets. It's like putting on a time capsule or somthein'.  [_he pulls out a letter_]  Oh, here, here's something from the world of yesterday.  [_Frasier takes the envelope._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, Dad, that's my home insurance payment.  I asked you to mail this three months ago.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sorry, Fraizh.  But you see what I mean about the jacket? I can still see him givin' me that envelope.  [_Frasier dials his cell phone.  Martin pulls another envelope out of a different pocket.  He looks at it, wide-eyed, then hurries out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: No wonder my agent's been calling me. My policy's probably been cancelled!  [_into the phone_]  Yes, Jim Sunquist, please. ... Yeah, Jim, it's Frasier Crane. ... Yes, I know.  I've just discovered that myself.  Listen, how much to renew? ... What?  Well, I'm gonna have to think that over. ... Uh, right, I'll call you.  Thanks, Jim.  [_He disconnects._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Scandinavian shyster!  Cold-hearted, glad-handed, highway-robber, phony big-toothed smiling son of a bitch insurance man!  [_He notices the phone is still on._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Not you, Jim.  Love to Marie.  [_He firmly disconnects._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn!  Now I'm going to have to pay twice as much!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, why don't you just find another insurer?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you know who you should talk to?  Ann Hodges!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, have you lost your mind?  I never want to see that woman again.

speaker: Niles
text: Who is she?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, a friend of Roz's.  We had a stunningly bad date, during which my behavior was...less than chivalrous.

speaker: Roz
text: You ate her ravioli, then hit on another woman in the same restaurant.

speaker: Frasier
text: Which I concede was less than chivalrous.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, the least you can do is throw her some business.  She just did mine and she did a great job.  And she can rush this through.  Here you go, here's her card.

speaker: Niles
text: You should be covered, Frasier.  God forbid something should happen, a pipe bursts, or Dad should screw up again. Remember the great bacon fire of '98?

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose spending ten minutes with the woman won't kill me.  [_Frasier pulls out his cell phone._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, Jim, hang up already!  [_He stabs at the buttons furiously.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier is getting off the elevator.  Caroline, his neighbor, is still on._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this is me.  Uh, thanks again for holding the elevator, Caroline.

speaker: Caroline
text: Well, you did throw your briefcase into it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  Well, you'd be surprised how many people just kick it back out and push the close button.  You know, maybe I could repay you by taking you to dinner some evening.

speaker: Caroline
text: Yeah, I'd like that.  How about next Monday?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perfect.  Why not stop by my place first for a drink? Around six o'clock?

speaker: Caroline
text: Sounds good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great.  Um, thanks again.  And...sorry again about the briefcase.   You might want to put some ice on that ankle.  [_He goes into his apartment as the elevator closes.  Cut to - the living room as he comes in.  Martin enters, eating._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Fraizh.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.  What have you got there?

speaker: Martin
text: I made a sandwich with some of your cold chicken in there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Also known as quail.  Think you can get a plate before you start dripping mayonnaise all over the place?  [_He puts his coat up._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, relax, I'm almost done.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, and by the way:  Until this home is insured once again, there will be no more barbecuing or deep frying.

speaker: Martin
text: Does that include the hot plate in my bedroom?

speaker: Frasier
text: Since when do you have a hot plate?!  [_The doorbell rings, Frasier goes to answer it._]

speaker: Martin
text: Since I finally figured out how to plug it in.  In just one outlet, I have my TV, aquarium, clock radio and that old space heater.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, unplug everything!  [_He opens the door to reveal Ann._]

speaker: Ann
text: [_cooly_]  Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Ann.  Please, won't you come in?  This is my father, Martin Crane.  [_He closes the door behind her._]

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, I've heard all about you.  Frasier and I used to go out.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh...  Well, I'll be in my room.  [_He heads off._]

speaker: Ann
text: So, this is kind of weird, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I hope that you're being here means that you've forgiven me?

speaker: Ann
text: Well, I was pretty steamed after that date, but my shrink helped me work through the rage.  Good thing you didn't walk in front of my car on the street for the first few weeks or I would've just gotten out and given you a good kick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and I would've deserved one, too.  Here, let me take your coat.  You're going to want to look around the place before you write up the policy.  [_He takes her coat back to hang it up._]

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, very nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.  Thank you very much.  [_She stops by one of his African masks._]

speaker: Ann
text: Hey, this guy looks like my ex.  [_Frasier laughs with her._]

speaker: Ann
text: I'm just kidding.  He wasn't black.

speaker: Frasier
text: Can I get you something to drink?

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, just a glass of water.  But I'll get it, I want to see your kitchen.  [_She steps into the kitchen, but keeps talking._]

speaker: Ann
text: Wow!  Shmancy!  And so clean.  You know, there's a homosexual couple that lives in my building and their kitchen is like a pigsty compared to yours.  Whoops, spoke too soon.  Somebody dripped a little bit of mayona...  [_She lets out a screech and there is a thud from the kitchen.  Frasier looks towards the kitchen nervously._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ann?  [_Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Martin and Frasier are with Ann.  She is in a wheelchair, a cast on her leg._]

speaker: Ann
text: Boy, who'da thunk a little mayo on the floor could end up breaking your leg?  [_Martin looks at Frasier, who is glowering at him.  The doctor comes in._]

speaker: Doctor
text: So, how's that cast feeling?

speaker: Ann
text: Okay.  I'm worried about my apartment, though.  It's a fourth floor walk-up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.  Well, is there a friend or a family member that we could call to come get you?

speaker: Ann
text: No.  Just my mom, and she lives in Portland.  [_The doctor is trying to look at an x-ray, but the machine isn't working._]

speaker: Doctor
text: Uh oh.

speaker: Ann
text: "Uh oh"?  What's that supposed to mean?  If you screwed anything up I will sue you blue, buddy boy!  [_Frasier and Martin share a panicked look._]

speaker: Doctor
text: No, no it's nothing.  The bulb burned out.  Now, let's find you a pair of crutches.

speaker: Ann
text: Okay.  [_He wheels her out the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Watch it on the turns there, Doc.  Precious cargo.  [_He closes the door behind them._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I hope you enjoyed your sandwich.  It may end up costing me my apartment.

speaker: Martin
text: You think she'll sue you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Dad, she's an INSURANCE WOMAN.  If anybody knows anything about milking money out of an injury, it's her.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, won't your insurance cover it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no insurance!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, right, right.  You know what?  Why don't you just try to get on her good side?  Pay all her expenses, maybe throw in a private nurse for a few days.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's good, that's good.  But she's too dangerous to be left alone with her thoughts right now.  We've got to try the personal approach.  I tell you what, why don't we inviter her to spend a few days recuperating in our apartment?

speaker: Martin
text: [_disgusted_]  Oh...

speaker: Frasier
text: Friends do not sue friends!  [_Ann comes in on crutches._]

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, my pits are barking already.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ann, listen, Dad and I were just talking.  We thought maybe you should just stay at our place, until you get used to your crutches.

speaker: Ann
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure.  That's what friends do.

speaker: Ann
text: Thanks.  Well, I'll call my super and have him send over some clothes and my trumpet and we're good to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: You play the trumpet?

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, I just started.  It's really hard.  [_She turns and goes out the door.  Frasier and Martin nervously follow her.  Fade out._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment_  [_Fade in.  Frasier is walking around the living room, picking up trash. Ann let's out a shout from the bedroom area._]

speaker: Ann
text: Hey!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sorry.  [_He walks into the living room._]

speaker: Martin
text: Dammit, Frasier, I just walked in on your insurance lady takin' a sponge bath.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God.  Which sponge?

speaker: Martin
text: The small one.  It's been the longest two days of my life.  [_He settles into his chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what do you think, it's been a vacation for me?  I have cooked her meals, I have massaged her feet.  I have also wildly applauded her trumpet rendition of "Froggy Went A-Courtin'".  [_The doorbell rings, Frasier goes to answer it._]

speaker: Frasier
text: But I have won her over.  There will be no discussion of a lawsuit tomorrow when I send her a-packin'.  [_He opens the door to reveal Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier.  Hey, Dad.  [_He hands Frasier a bag._]

speaker: Niles
text: Brace yourself, I have finally gotten around to returning your escargot clamps.  [_He goes to hang up his coat.  Frasier pulls one of the clamps out of the bag._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's what those are.  I've been usin' 'em to pull ticks off Eddie's coat.

speaker: Niles
text: Sherry?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, please.  Thank you.  [_Niles goes over to the wine area._]

speaker: Niles
text: I have Maris news: She's auctioning off some of her things to help pay for her defense.  She's letting me come by first to claim anything I want.  Well, this is my chance to seize and destroy my boudoir painting.

speaker: Martin
text: What's that?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, years ago Maris and I got the idea it into our heads to commission portraits of a... well, quasi-erotic nature.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God.  [_He brings Frasier's sherry over to him.  Martin, a look of disgust on his face gets up and goes to the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Continue.  [_They sit._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Maris is depicted as a doe-eyed wood nymph, while in my painting I am the satyr Pan.  A louche sybaritic goat-man with a depraved appetite for all things sensual.  [_Ann comes in on her crutches._]

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, I forgot to lock that door.  Your dad sure got an eye full.  [_Frasier and Niles get up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, uh, bumbling old man, I'm terribly sorry.

speaker: Ann
text: Well, no birthday gift for him this year, he's had it.  Hi, Niles.  [_Frasier forces a laugh while Niles makes a face._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Ann.  It's so nice to see you, I'm sorry I can't stay.  [_He goes to grab his coat._]

speaker: Ann
text: You're leaving?  You're always leaving.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, just lately.  Bye.  [_He sweeps out the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye-bye, Niles.  Well, wait 'til you see what I've made you for dinner tonight.  Your favorite:  mac and cheese with sliced hot dogs.  [_He grabs some things and heads for the kitchen._]

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, you keep pampering me this way, it'll be hard for me to go home next month.  [_Martin drops something in the kitchen as Ann lowers herself onto the couch._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Next month?!

speaker: Ann
text: Well, let's cross our fingers. My bones tend to knit slowly.  [_Martin comes out of the kitchen, looking horrified._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, aren't you afraid to leave your apartment unattended for an entire month?

speaker: Ann
text: No problem.  I just sub-let it this morning to a girl from work.  If she chips so much as one of my porcelain piggies, I'll sue her six ways to Sunday!  [_Frasier turns to go into the kitchen.  Martin mutters as he goes past._]

speaker: Martin
text: If you want to beat her to death with one of her crutches I can show you how to make it look like an accident.  [_The go into the kitchen together.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Marta is leading Niles into the living room, which is crowded with things._]  [_N.B. This is Marta's first appearance since[[4.23]](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_23/ask_me_no_questions.html "Ask Me No Questions"), "Ask Me No Questions."_]

speaker: Marta
text: Here is everything.  I tell Missy Crane you are here.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Marta.  [_She heads back upstairs._]

speaker: Martin
text: Wow.  Maybe I can find something nice for Ronee here.  This whole Ann thing has got me practically livin' over there.  [_Daphne picks up an item._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Look at this fancy back scratcher.

speaker: Niles
text: That's not exactly what it is.  Every winter Maris would fly down to the private island her family owns in the south Pacific.  On Christmas she'd let the native children come by and fish coins from the fountain.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, some kind of coin-scooper, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, it's a stick with a claw on the end it in case any of the children got too close to her.  [_Niles looks around for a moment, then grabs a painting._]

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, I found me.  Daphne, avert your eyes.   Let's get this thing wrapped up and into my trunk.  [_Daphne rolls her eyes and turns her back.  Martin comes around and looks at the painting._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez.  How could you stand to look at yourself like that?

speaker: Niles
text: I never had to.  It was in Maris' bedroom.  [_He covers it with a cloth, then calls out._]

speaker: Niles
text: Marta, tell Maris we'll be back to say goodbye..

speaker: Marta
text: [_calling from upstairs_] Yes, Dr. Crane.  [_As they leave with the painting, Marta comes down.  She checks to see that they've gone, then steps over to a thin crate with a small hole in it._]

speaker: Marta
text: You were right, Missy Crane.  They take the painting right away.  [_She holds up a plastic cup and sticks a straw from it into the hole._]

speaker: Marta
text: Now drink your protein shake, you've got a long trip ahead of you.  [_There is a slurping sound and the level in the cup drops a bit._]

speaker: Marta
text: Oh, very good, Missy Crane, you drink a lot! ... What?  Too much?  Okay.  [_She puts the straw back and the cup refills.  There is a sound at the door._]

speaker: Marta
text: Oh, here they come!  [_She puts the cup down and hurries off as the Cranes re-enter._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Can we leave now?  This place gives me the chills.

speaker: Niles
text: It was designed to.  Just let me say goodbye to Maris and we'll...  [_He breaks off as Marta comes back down the stairs again, crying out._]

speaker: Niles
text: What is it, Marta?

speaker: Marta
text: I no find Missy Crane.  I go up to her room and all there is is this note.  [_She hands a note to Niles, who unfolds it and reads._]

speaker: Niles
text: Dear God.  She says she doesn't believe she can get a fair trial and she can't face life in prison, so she's going to hurl herself off the State Senator Harry R. Burton Bridge. Marta, when was the last time you saw Maris?

speaker: Marta
text: Just before you come.

speaker: Niles
text: Then we can still catch her.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, don't panic.  She still has that tracking device, the cops'll stop her.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but if we can catch her, maybe I can talk her down.  [_They hurry out.  Marta goes back to the crate._]

speaker: Marta
text: Perfect, Missy Crane.  I put the tracking bracelet behind the painting just like you say.  The workmen will take you in a minute... What?  Okay.  [_She grabs the cup and puts the straw back in the hole.  Instead of being drunk, the liquid level goes up even higher.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Roz gets off the elevator.  Frasier is leaning against the wall outside his door, reading a paper._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier, I'm glad I caught you.  Did you just get home?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I've been here a while.  Can't bring myself to go in. Not with her in there.  [_There is a sound of a trumpet badly sounding the scales from inside the apartment._]

speaker: Frasier
text: She's getting better.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, I did you a favor.  My lawyer drew up this document, it releases you from all liability, if you just get Ann to sign it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, there's no way I'm going to get her to sign this. But I have a better plan:  I've just booked passage for her and her mother on a two week cruise to Alaska.  That way I'll get her out of my home, but we'll still feel like we're friends.

speaker: Roz
text: Hmm, not a bad idea.  Good luck with that.  [_She presses the button and the elevator opens._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Roz, I've been meaning to ask you:  how did you ever become friends with Ann?  I mean, she's really not your type, is she?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, we're not really friends.  I rear ended her in 1989.  [_She lets the doors close, smiling at Frasier's shocked look.  Cut to - the living room.  Ann is on the phone as Frasier comes in._]

speaker: Ann
text: Well I say divorce him and take him to the cleaners.  When you play with someone's heart, you deserve to pay big time.  My ex sure did. ... [_laughing_]  Yes, he's still living in his van and he's lucky I let him keep that.  Listen, I gotta go.  My Bunny's home and he's looking so handsome.  Okay, I'll call you later.  [_She hangs up.  Frasier has a worried look on his face as he takes off his coat._]

speaker: Ann
text: You!  Alaska!  [_She gets up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, the tickets arrived.

speaker: Ann
text: You bet they did.  I just called my mother and she's thrilled.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'd hoped she would be.

speaker: Ann
text: She can't believe that you're taking me to Alaska!

speaker: Frasier
text: You told her I was taking you?

speaker: Ann
text: Don't worry, I told her your intentions were honorable. [_whispering knowingly_]  But they better not be.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ann...

speaker: Ann
text: You know, I've been wondering all week "Why is Frasier keeping me here?"  He could've just sent me home with a nurse.  But then I got these and I figured it out:  you've got a thing for me.  Well, I've got news for you Romeo...

speaker: Frasier
text: Hold that thought, while Bunny goes and pours himself a big ol' glass o' wine.  [_He starts for the liquor cabinet, but turns back when the doorbell rings.  He opens it to reveal Caroline._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Caroline.

speaker: Caroline
text: Hi, Frasier.  Am I early?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh...

speaker: Ann
text: Who are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh...just a neighbor.

speaker: Caroline
text: Is our date still on?

speaker: Ann
text: Date!?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pained_]  No.  Since we made our plans, Caroline, I've met someone else.

speaker: Ann
text: Me!  So beat it.

speaker: Caroline
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just go!  [_He closes the door on her face._]

speaker: Ann
text: Well...someone's quite the tomcat.  I don't know what I'm gonna do with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_darkly_]  I don't know what I'm gonna do with you either.  [_He heads for the kitchen.  Ann picks up the indemnity release._]

speaker: Ann
text: Hey, hey Bunny, what's this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's nothing.  Just some work stuff.

speaker: Ann
text: It's got my name on it.  It's a liability release!   Oh, my gosh, you think I'm gonna sue you.

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Ann
text: So that's why you've been so nice to me.  Because you're afraid of a lawsuit.  So this whole romance was just a fake!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Ann
text: You were leading me on!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, never!

speaker: Ann
text: Well I've got news for you!  Nobody plays with my heart!  I should sue you!

speaker: Frasier
text: I realize that you're angry now, Bunny...

speaker: Ann
text: YOU'RE Bunny!  I'm calling a lawyer!  [_She hobbles towards the phone._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, fine!  Go ahead and sue!  I am fed up with this charade!  This was an accident! I have cared for you, I have waited on you, I have pumiced your heels and set your HAIR! Well, if that's not enough for you, so be it!  I don't care anymore, I will not BEG!  You can take me to the cleaners but you cannot take my dignity!

speaker: Ann
text: Okay, see you in court.  [_Frasier stumbles to the couch and falls to his knees._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear God, please, no!  Pleas, no, no, please!  Please, please don't sue me!  My...things, my beautiful, beautiful things.  I love them so...  [_He hugs his coffee table._]

speaker: Ann
text: Are you crying?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_weeping_]  No.

speaker: Ann
text: Gross.  Frasier, pull yourself together.  I'll sign your stupid paper.  [_Frasier gets to his feet._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You will?

speaker: Ann
text: God, to think I had a thing for you.  Can I pick 'em or what?  [_Frasier hands her a pen.  She takes it and signs the release._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Ann.  I'm sorry it had to come down to all this, this legal business.  If it were up to me, I would tear up this piece of paper and forget everything that's happened here.  [_He lifts the page._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And, uh, here.  [_He points and she signs.  He lifts that page._]

speaker: Frasier
text: And...here.  [_She signs again.  Fade out._]   **THE PAN-AMERICAN HIGHWAY**  [_Fade in.  Daphne is driving, Niles is on his cell phone and Martin is in the back seat._]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, officer, we're headed east on Highway 61, toward for the bridge.  Do you have a read on her tracking bracelet yet? They say she just passed Exit 29.

speaker: Martin
text: We just passed Exit 29.  I don't see anyone ahead of us.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you suppose we passed her?

speaker: Daphne
text: There is a car behind us.  [_The car behind them starts flashing red and blue lights and a cop calls out over the loudspeaker._]

speaker: Patrolman
text: Pull over immediately.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, you were a cop, what do we do?

speaker: Martin
text: Pull over immediately.  [_Daphne pulls the car to the side of the road.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Daphne, Niles and Martin are standing in front of a highway patrolman at the side of the highway._]

speaker: Niles
text: We don't have time for this, we need to get to the bridge!

speaker: Patrolman
text: According to her tracking device, your wife is in this vehicle.

speaker: Niles
text: But that's absurd!

speaker: Daphne
text: And she's his ex-wife.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, the press is here!

speaker: Patrolman
text: Open the trunk, sir.

speaker: Niles
text: Look, look, please, there's an item of a very personal nature in there, if you could just keep the media away...

speaker: Patrolman
text: [_drawing his gun_] Now!  [_Niles opens the trunk._]

speaker: Niles
text: See, see?  No Maris.  [_The patrolman pulls the painting out._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, careful with that, that's what I didn't want you to...  [_The patrolman pulls the cover off._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez!

speaker: Patrolman
text: What the hell is that?

speaker: Niles
text: It's Pan, the satyr.  A minor god of mischief, debauchery and fornication. [_The patrolman looks disgusted._]

speaker: Daphne
text: That's what our son would look like if I were a goat.  [_The patrolman checks the back of the painting and holds up the tracking bracelet._]

speaker: Patrolman
text: Here's your tracking device, right there.

speaker: Martin
text: She conned us!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you have your bracelet, I guess I'll just take my painting.

speaker: Patrolman
text: Sorry, sir, this is evidence.  [_He picks it up and swings around towards the news crews._]

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, don't...!  [_The painting ends up fully in the spotlight, with Niles right next to it.  Cameras flash as the photographers all take pictures.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Martin and Frasier are at the dining table, Niles is standing and reading a letter from Maris._]

speaker: Niles
text: "So, I shipped myself to our private island where, like dear Uncle Julius, I will be immune from extradition.  Thank you all and forgive me.  Best regards, Maris.  P.S.  Big ups to all my homeys in lock-down.  Stay black, Cell Block D."  [_He sits down._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, you were the decoys.  It's ingenious.

speaker: Niles
text: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Martin
text: How'd she get the tracking bracelet off?

speaker: Niles
text: Apparently she swallowed a salt tablet to make her ankle swell right before they fitted her.  Then, when the swelling went down, the bracelet just slipped right off.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, that's it.  No more Maris.

speaker: Niles
text: Strange to think I'll never see her again.

speaker: Martin
text: She was a pain, but she was a character.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, let's drink a toast to her.  Well, just a drop left.

speaker: Niles
text: Perfect, I can't think of a more fitting toast.  [_Frasier pours the last bit of wine into Niles and Martin's glasses._]

speaker: Frasier
text: There we go.  [_They all raise their glasses._]

speaker: Niles
text: To Maris.  [_They touch glasses and drink.  Fade out._]  [_N.B. This was the last episode filmed before Jane Leeves gave birth to her second child, on December 19th, 2003.  The next episode filmed after this was "BOO!" in which she appeared only in the tag.  After that, she wears a false stomach in every episode until Daphne gives birth._]
